intro: Loxoscaphe schimperi, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap and showy, fragrant flowers that open at night. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive hooded shape. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
